questions.text: Who did George once sleep with?
questions.explanation:
Jodi.

	George tells Jerry that Kramer had actually asked if he wanted to travel with him to California in the season 3 finale, "The Keys".  Jerry says that George should've told him since George is horrible at keeping secrets, and George says that it's probably a record since his previous record was when he tried to prevent people from knowing that he slept with Jodi Hirsch.

questions.text: What show does Jerry get a guest appearance on?
questions.explanation:
The Tonight Show.

	Jerry is invited to California to appear on the show, so he gets two free tickets to go.  He and George decide that once they're in California, they'll try and track down Kramer.

questions.text: Who does Kramer try to call in the hotel in California?
questions.explanation:
Candice Bergen.

	Kramer appeared on "Murphy Brown" in the episode, "The Keys" as Candice Bergen's assistant.  When he tries to get a hold of her, he reaches her secretary and she hangs the phone up on him.

questions.text: How many days are George and Jerry on the trip for?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	This is mentioned when George arrives at Jerry's apartment.  Although the two are only going for two days, George decides to bring multiple suitcases and bags because he says that he dresses according to his mood.

questions.text: Jerry sets off the metal detector in the airport.
questions.explanation:
True.

	While Jerry is being checked over, George is forced to root through his bag to show the airport official what's inside. It turns out that Jerry didn't have anything on him made of metal, but for someone checked him anyways.

questions.text: What does Kramer not audition for?
questions.explanation:
A game show.

	Kramer also auditions for an exercise video.  He manages to meet someone at the audition, but she ends up getting murdered.

questions.text: What is the name of the maid who works at the hotel that Jerry and George stay at?
questions.explanation:
Lupe.

	Once at the hotel, George discovers what the room has to offer while Jerry tries to find Kramer.  George asks Lupe if she can make the bed without tucking his covers under the mattress.

questions.text: What happened to the napkin Jerry had with jokes written on it?
options: It had coffee spilled on it
It was all in a dream
questions.explanation:
It was thrown out.

	While cleaning the room, Lupe accidentally threw out the napkin, and Jerry lost the jokes he planned on using on "The Tonight Show".  He was upset because he spent a long time wording and perfecting them.

questions.text: George meets Robert Stack and Corbin Bernsen backstage.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He does meet Corbin Bernsen (who used to be on "L.A. Law"), but he also meets "Cheers'" George Wendt.   He ends up telling them stories from his past and they use George's stories on the show.

questions.text: Does Elaine appear in this episode?
questions.explanation:
No.

	At the time of filming, Julia Louis-Dreyfus was on maternity leave, so she was cut out of the first two shows in the season.  She appears in minor roles in the third and fourth episodes of this season.
